snippet: The number of international students applying to graduate schools in the United States increased just 1 percent this year, the smallest increase in eight years, according to a report.
abstract: Council of Graduate Schools report shows number of international students applying to graduate schools in United States increased just 1 percent in 2013, after 9 percent rise in 2012 and 11 percent gain in 2011.
lead_paragraph: The number of international students applying to graduate schools in the United States increased just 1 percent this year, the smallest increase in eight years, according to a report.

headline.seo: Graduate School Applications From Abroad Rise Just Barely
headline.main: Graduate School Applications From Abroad Rise Just Barely
headline.print_headline: Graduate School Applications From Abroad Rise Just Barely
